data.title: Japanese food
data.text: The food was delicious.  I ordered a bento box, my daughter ordered a lion king roll, and we ordered a bento box for my grandson.  Kind of disappointed that they did not have children's plate.  We waited a few minutes to have our order taken even though there was not that many people.  Overall the food was delicious.

data.title: One of the better places in A Town
data.text: With so many Japanese restaurants in Alameda, it's always difficult to decide where to go. We just gave this place another try for dinner tonight and it was a pleasant surprise.  The service was prompt and the food was delicious.  The scallop appetizer was tasty, the salmon teriyaki bento was very good and the chirashi bowl was fresh. Definitely one of my favorites in Alameda.

data.title: Never again.
data.text:
I was a regular here until tonight. When I walked in every table in the restaurant had filthy dishes stacked. There were only about for occupied tables. There was a smell in the restaurant of garbage with all the dirty dishes.

I offered to sit at the sushi bar at 1 free space, but that did not motivate anyone to clean the two spaces next to me which were piled with smelly fishy dishes. So I asked to move to a table. The waitress cleaned one table for me. Then she took my order.

40 minutes later there was still no food, and there was no explanation. When I told her that I had to leave she said all the food is coming. I got up and walked to the register to pay for my diet coke and edamame and noticed that my food was nowhere near coming. The very slow sushi chef was preparing something with the fried crab inside.

After she charged me $5.75 for a diet Pepsi and an edamame she explained that they had run out of rice. They had to wait for more rice to cook. Such a warning when I had walked in would have been appreciated. It's after 9:07 p.m. and I still haven't eaten dinner.

I've eaten here so many times they know me by name, but never again. West far every time I've eaten here I've been one of the only ones in the restaurant. Apparently they cannot operate when they have more than a couple people in the restaurant

data.title: Fantastic tuna fast service
data.text: About the best raw tuna I've had anywhere. Always ultra fresh dark red perfect flavor. Absolutely never fishy taste. Sushi rolls are the perfect size. I never leave here dissatisfied. I don't hand out 5.0 reviews very often.

data.title: Decent  food, slow service
data.text:
Had lunch  here and my biggest  complaint is that  there were only two tables seated (we were one of them), and everything  took quite a long time.  Iur waiter was nixe, but forgot our miso soup and one of our rolls. 

We ordered
Soft shell crab app: decent
Salmon pizza : salmon was really fresh and delicious
Children roll: rich and delicious 
Super  crunchy  roll: good. Great big  portion
Philly roll: average 

Overall....I'd  probably come back, but not ever if I'm  in a hurry.

data.title: Nice Decor
data.text: The renovation has given this restaurant a nice makeover.  However, the food is still average. The service is attentive and efficient. This is a good place to grab a quick affordable lunch.

data.title: Reopened and more spacious
data.text: We heard about this place from friends and had been wanting to try it so since they just re-opened about a week ago after being closed for a few months for remodeling, we decided to go there for lunch.  The dining area is spacious but the lighting in the daytime is on the dark side so it was hard to see the menu unless you are under a track light.  We ordered the miso tofu bento, 3 item combos of chicken and beef teriyaki and gyoza and beef and salmon teriyaki and sashimi.  All in all it was good for a first time there but the beef was not sliced as beef teriyaki should be, which should be in slices as it was a bit stringy.  We will have to try some other items on the menu next time.  It seems like the sushi is popular here so that's what we will have next time!  The sashimi tasted fresh!

data.title: If you are looking for great fresh Sushi in downtown Alameda, look no further.
data.text: My husband and I are Sushi lovers and have tried all the places in Alameda, however, Sakura restaurant is our favorite because it offers an intimate setting, the food is made to order, and the customer service is excellent. Highly recommended.

data.title: Continue Googling or walk 150 yards south bound to Kamakura for Japanese
data.text: Kamakura, our favorite Japanese restaurant, was closed so we decided to try Sakura.  Unlike Kamakura which is real Japanese and owned, this is not.  I ordered the chicken teriyaki and the chicken was over grilled and had no chicken taste.  However, the teriyaki sauce was good.  The service was minimal and below par if you let them know it's your first time there.  There were people coming in carrying colored plastic bags  of food and I guess they knew them.  They were talking loud.  Maybe they were friends or distributors bringing in food for the day.  I'm thinking, why didn't they do their talking in the back or even come through the back (if there is one).  I tried to ignore it since I already, after taking my first bite, didn't care for the food.  I know this is my opinion but if you just walk down to Kamakura, it'll be night and day to you in many ways.  Two thumbs down for this joint.

data.title: This is the Sushi place...
data.text: This is the Sushi place we go to. Good prices, good sushi.
